brief_summary.textblock: After cochlear implantation, cochlear nerve is stimulated by giving a current over the electrodes placed in the cochlea and the current is measured by electrically evoked Compound Action Potential (ECAP).This ECAP is measured intra operatively, after 4 weeks( at switch on), after 3months and 6 months following cochlear implantation.

detailed_description.textblock: After cochlear implantation, cochlear nerve is stimulated by giving a current over the electrodes placed in the cochlea and the current is measured by electrically evoked Compound Action Potential (ECAP).This ECAP is measured intra operatively, 4 weeks(at switch on) and after 3months and 6 months following cochlear implantation. Neural Response Telemetry (NRT) is a quick and non-invasive way of recording ECAP of the peripheral auditory nerves in-situ. It gives clinicians valuable information for programming the T- (Threshold) and C-(Comfort) - levels of the recipient's speech processor map. Intraoperative NRT in conjunction with electrode impedance data can help indicate the integrity of the implanted electrodes and the electrode/auditory nerve interface, confirming that the implant is functioning correctly intraoperatively.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in threshold of ECAP after cochlear implantation.
primary_outcome.time_frame: during implantation, at switch on( 4 weeks), after 3months and 6months.
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate changes in threshold of ECAP during cochlear implantation, at switch on( 4 weeks), after 3 months and 6 months following cochlear implantation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlate the amplitude of ECAP with T & C levels.
secondary_outcome.description: Correlating the amplitude of ECAP with threshold and comfortable levels and creating a MAP.

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlate amplitude of ECAP with cochlear nerve diameter measured pre-operatively.
secondary_outcome.description: By correlating amplitude of ECAP with cochlear nerve diameter we can determine the site to be operated preoperatively.
